data.title: Best Jazz Christmas Albums
data.meta_description: Best Jazz Christmas Albums aka 12 Days of Jazzmas features Oscar Peterson, Ramsey Lewis Trio, Louis Armstrong, Jimmy Smith, Classical Jazz Quartet, Dexter Gordon Quartet, McCoy Tyner, The Arthur Blythe Quartet, Heath Brothers, Dave Brubeck, Vince Guaraldi Trio, Paquito D’Rivera, Wynton Marsalis Quin
data.text:
God Rest Ye Merry Jazzmen - Various Artists

A compilation of Christmas songs featuring The Dexter Gordon Quartet, McCoy Tyner, The Arthur Blythe Quartet, The Heath Brothers, Paquito D’Rivera, and The Wynton Marsalis Quintet.

Christmas - The Classical Jazz Quartet

A Jazz superstar group featuring Kenny Barron, Ron Carter, Stefon Harris & Lewis Nash. This album features music mostly taken from their Bach and Tchaikovsky Christmas classics.

Sound of Christmas - Ramsey Lewis Trio

A classic – and probably one of the best-selling Christmas jazz albums of all time! Ramsey and his classic trio with Redd Holt and Eldee Young serve up a tight set of grooves based around Holiday favorites.

A Charlie Brown Christmas - Vince Guaraldi Trio

This album serves as the soundtrack to the classic “A Charlie Brown Christmas” Television special and it is one of the most beloved holiday albums recorded. Guaraldi is joined by Bassist Fred Marshall and drummer Jerry Granelli.

Christmas Cookin' - Jimmy Smith & Wes Montgomery

This Christmas jazz album has five selections in which organist Jimmy Smith is joined by a big band arranged by either Billy Byers or Al Cohn. The remaining selections feature Smith with guitarist Wes Montgomery.

Favorite Things - John Coltrane

Although not featured on a Christmas album, this tune deserves to be mentioned due to its impact on the trajectory of Coltrane’s writing and musical thought process.

What A Wonderful Christmas - Louis Armstrong & Friends

This album classic album features everyone from Dinah Washington to Mel Torme, from Louis Jordan to Eartha Kitt and an astounding assortment of artists in between.
